name: Redis
title: This is a [redis](https://redis.io/) quick reference cheat sheet that lists examples of redis commands

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This is a [redis](https://redis.io/) quick reference cheat sheet that lists examples of redis commands

cards.title: Getting started
cards.body:
Start Redis

```shell script
$ redis-server

```

Connect to redis (Redis CLI client)

```shell script
$ redis-cli
```

Connect to redis (telnet)

```shell script
$ telnet 127.0.0.1 6379

```

### Hello World

#### Ping

```shell script
redis> PING
PONG
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> BITFIELD mykey INCRBY i5 100 1 GET u4 0
1) (integer) 1
2) (integer) 0

```

Perform arbitrary bitfield integer operations on strings

### BITOP

```{.wrap}
BITOP operation destkey key [key ...]
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> SETBIT mykey 7 1
(integer) 0
redis> GETBIT mykey 0
(integer) 0
redis> GETBIT mykey 7
(integer) 1
redis> GETBIT mykey 100
(integer) 0

```

Returns the bit value at offset in the string value stored at key

### GETRANGE

```{.wrap}
GETRANGE key start end
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> RPUSH mylist a b c d 1 2 3 4 3 3 3
(integer) 11
redis> LPOS mylist 3
(integer) 6
redis> LPOS mylist 3 COUNT 0 RANK 2
1) (integer) 8
2) (integer) 9
3) (integer) 10

```

Return the index of matching elements on a list

### LPUSH

```{.wrap}
LPUSH key element [element ...]
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> HSET myhash field 5
(integer) 1
redis> HINCRBY myhash field 1
(integer) 6
redis> HINCRBY myhash field -1
(integer) 5
redis> HINCRBY myhash field -10
(integer) -5

```

Increment the integer value of a hash field by the given number

### HINCRBYFLOAT

```{.wrap}
HINCRBYFLOAT key field increment
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> ZADD myzset 0 a 0 b 0 c 0 d 0 e
(integer) 5
redis> ZADD myzset 0 f 0 g
(integer) 2
redis> ZLEXCOUNT myzset - +
(integer) 7
redis> ZLEXCOUNT myzset [b [f
(integer) 5

```

Count the number of members in a sorted set between a given lexicographical range

### ZPOPMAX

```{.wrap}
ZPOPMAX key [count]
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> PFADD hll a b c d e f g
(integer) 1
redis> PFCOUNT hll
(integer) 7

```

Adds the specified elements to the specified HyperLogLog.

### PFCOUNT

```{.wrap}
PFCOUNT key [key ...]
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> PFADD hll foo bar zap
(integer) 1
redis> PFADD hll zap zap zap
(integer) 0
redis> PFADD hll foo bar
(integer) 0
redis> PFCOUNT hll
(integer) 3
redis> PFADD some-other-hll 1 2 3
(integer) 1
redis> PFCOUNT hll some-other-hll
(integer) 6

```

Return the approximated cardinality of the set(s) observed by the HyperLogLog at key(s).

### PFMERGE

```{.wrap}
PFMERGE destkey sourcekey [sourcekey ...]
```

cards.title: Example
cards.body:
```shell script
redis> COMMAND COUNT
(integer) 217

```

Get total number of Redis commands

### COMMAND GETKEYS

```{.wrap}
COMMAND GETKEYS
```

cards.title: Getting Started
cards.body:
redis_version:6.1.240
redis_git_sha1:00000000
redis_git_dirty:0
redis_build_id:a26db646ea64a07c
redis_mode:standalone
os:Linux 5.4.0-1017-aws x86_64
......

cards.title: Getting Started
cards.body:
```

Get information and statistics about the server

### ROLE

```{.wrap}
ROLE
```
